item.title: Scotland to ease restrictions but face masks still mandatory
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon says the whole of Scotland will move to a "modified" level zero from 19 July.

item.title: Stalking rises during Covid pandemic - police
item.description: Over 80,000 incidents are recorded in 2020 in England and Wales - but arrests struggle to keep up.

item.title: Government wins vote to lock in cuts to overseas aid
item.description: Boris Johnson sees off attempt by Tory MPs to restore development spending to 0.7% of national income.

item.title: Covid-19: Scotland to ease restrictions, 1.5m pupils absent from school in England
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

item.title: Man in China reunited with son snatched 24 years ago
item.description: Abduction of children is a big problem in the country, with tens of thousands taken every year.

item.title: Molesey Lock: Siblings snap lightning strike selfie
item.description: Rachel, Isobel and Andrew Jobson were injured as they took the photo during a thunderstorm.

item.title: Social media influencers face relentless abuse, MPs are told
item.description: Em Sheldon says people are "so angry" at her for using her online platforms for commercial gain.

item.title: Emmys 2021: The Crown and The Mandalorian lead Emmy nominations
item.description: Both shows have 24 nominations apiece, other shows recognised include WandaVision and Pose.

item.title: Bloody Sunday: Colum Eastwood names Soldier F in parliament
item.description: The identity of a former paratrooper, accused of two murders on Bloody Sunday, had been kept anonymous.

item.title: Spanish TikTok star Darrechi angers many with condom remarks
item.description: Naim Darrechi, who has millions of fans, suggested he had deceived women to have unprotected sex.

item.title: Uefa probe over security breaches at Euro 2020 final
item.description: Uefa opens disciplinary proceedings into events surrounding the Euro 2020 final, including the actions of England fans inside and around Wembley.

item.title: Rashford mural artist: 'Incredible how people have come together'
item.description: Street artist Akse, who has repaired his Rashford mural, says local people have united to show their support.

item.title: Zsa Zsa Gabor: Hollywood legend laid to rest in Hungary
item.description: The birthplace burial comes gives years after the legendary Hollywood actress and socialite died aged 99.

item.title: Marcus Rashford: Messages of pride and positivity left on mural
item.description: Hundreds of messages adorn the vandalised mural in honour of footballer Marcus Rashford.

item.title: Giant goldfish problem in US lake prompts warning to pet owners
item.description: Goldfish released into the wild can grow much bigger and cause major disruption to ecosystems.

item.title: England football racism: Black and Asian fans 'so proud' of Southgate's team
item.description: Binta Williams, 22, is one of many new fans loving the diversity of the Euro 2020 England squad.

item.title: Bank scammer threatens BBC reporter over the phone
item.description: A fraudster threatens a BBC reporter during a call supposedly from his bank after a text scam.

item.title: Why people in Eswatini are calling for change
item.description: Dozens of people have died in recent protests calling for reform of Eswatini's absolute monarchy.

item.title: Royal Academy: Hull boy, 5, gets artwork in summer show
item.description: Vincent painted the pictures to be exhibited while learning at home in the first Covid lockdown.

item.title: Met Police seize record £180m of cryptocurrency in London
item.description: The seizure is the largest of its kind in the UK - beating the previous record set just weeks ago.

item.title: Firms left to decide own rules on face masks
item.description: Travel firms and others are setting out their own safety rules for when legal bindings lift.

item.title: Flash floods in parts of London leaves cars submerged as roads fill with water
item.description: Heavy rain has caused flash floods in parts of London, leaving cars submerged and roads filled with water.

item.title: Nadiya Hussain: 'I've wanted to bleach the brown out of me'
item.description: Nadiya Hussain talks to comedian Ali Shahalom about being British Bangladeshi in 2021.

item.title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
item.description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

item.title: The Papers: 'Ugly face of football' and 'freedom day' in England
item.description: Tuesday's papers react to three England players being subjected to racist abuse.

item.title: In numbers: Life in Afghanistan after America leaves
item.description: How did 20 years of war between the US and the Taliban change Afghanistan?

item.title: Foreign aid: Who will be hit by the UK government cuts?
item.description: The UK government is reducing its spending this year on foreign aid - with major consequences for some recipients.

item.title: How your driving might reveal early signs of Alzheimer's
item.description: Research shows how small changes in the way you drive could expose preclinical signs of disease.

item.title: What's taking the knee and why was it an issue at Euro 2020?
item.description: Taking the knee has spread across the world as a statement against racism.

item.title: Plastic surgery booming in China despite the dangers
item.description: Young people are using social media apps to plan cosmetic procedures which don't always meet expectations.

item.title: Uttar Pradesh bill: The myth of India's population explosion
item.description: India's most populous state has a contentious plan for curbing population growth. But is it necessary?

item.title: US heatwave: Could US and Canada see the worst wildfires yet?
item.description: The annual fire season has barely started - and there are claims that 2021 might be the worst year yet.

item.title: England 'must be let off the leash'
item.description: After losing the Euro 2020 final on penalties to Italy, BBC Sport's Phil McNulty looks at how manager Gareth Southgate can take England to the next step.

item.title: Capitol riots: What we have learned six months on
item.description: Arrests and probes continue as some conservatives seek to cast 6 January in a different light.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Roger Federer pulls out of Olympic Games
item.description: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer pulls out of the Tokyo Olympics because of a knee injury.

item.title: Sancho has medical at Man Utd as £73m move edges closer
item.description: England winger Jadon Sancho has a medical as his £73m move to Manchester United from Borussia Dortmund edges closer.

item.title: Austria's Konrad claims first stage win of Tour de France
item.description: Patrick Konrad from Austria holds off the chasing group to claim stage 16 of the Tour de France.

item.title: England v Pakistan: Matt Parkinson bowls Imam ul-Haq for 56
item.description: England's Matt Parkinson produces a magnificent turning delivery to bowl Pakistan's Imam ul-Haq for 56 in the final ODI of the three-match series at Edgbaston.

item.title: Covid rules: Is lockdown ending on 19 July?
item.description: Covid restrictions will ease again in both England and Scotland on 19 July.

item.title: What's the new guidance on face masks and coverings?
item.description: Face coverings are to remain in Scotland, while people in England won't have wear them after 19 July.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England could have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: The working from home advice in England is set to change on 19 July.

item.title: How many cases are in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
item.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.

item.title: Why Canada is reforming indigenous foster care
item.description: The residential school legacy has been linked to the overrepresentation of indigenous children in care.
